result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J. KWASNY

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to a charge of felon possessing firearm in case no: 15 CF 420.  Motion granted.

Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-17-15 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Fail to report to jail, on 10-01-03.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts failure to report to jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond. Bail furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence.
Minutes.
